s.text: The Wall Street Journal 's "Work Week" column notes that for employees who like to surf the Internet at work, Tripod Inc.'s Web site has a "panic button" for use when the boss shows up.
The Wall Street Journal 's "Work Week" column notes that for employees who like to surf the Internet at work, Tripod Inc.'s Web site has a "panic button" for use when the boss shows up.
USAT says that the Justice Department task force investigating Clinton's phone calls is recommending that Janet Reno take no action in that matter.
And the paper quotes Clinton in reaction to Reno's recent statement that she was 'mad' about the White House's lag on the coffee tapes: "You should have been there when I heard about it."
The paper quotes Clinton saying he doesn't blame the WHCA.

(She could, besides ending the investigation, also continue looking into it, or ask a court to name an independent counsel.)
